article.title: Frequency Monitoring Station Project Moves to Phase II
article.text: Range Generation Next LLC, Sterling, Virginia, has been awarded a $8,087,335 modification (P00018) cost-plus-fixed-fee for the frequency monitoring station phase II project at Vandenberg Air Force Base, California. Contractor will replace and upgrade frequency monitoring equipment that is part of the launch and test range system (LTRS) to better comply with documented operational requirements. Work will be performed at Vandenberg Air Force Base, California, and is expected to be completed by February 20, 2020. This award is the result of an in-scope modification/project for the LTRS integrated support contract. Fiscal 2013 other procurement funds in the amount of $8,087,335 are being obligated at the time of award. Space and Missile Systems Center, Peterson Air Force Base, Colorado, is the contracting activity (F8806-15-C-0001).
